name: X and The Blasters in Petaluma
description:
This poster is for the X/Blasters Family X-mas tour stop in Petaluma on 12/15/13. Size is 16"x20". Two color screen print on 100lb white French cover stock. This print is extremely limited as 1/2 the run is currently lost in the mail. If the package is ever recovered, more will go on sale. 40 prints were produced for this edition. Half the edition is currently lost.

UPDATE: I am currently sold out of prints on hand. The good news is that the lost shipment has been located and is making it's way back to Chicago. These prints will be available for sale again once the shipment arrives. Please note, if you place an order after December 16, Your poster won't ship until the posters arrive back in my shop. Posters purchased on 12/16 or before will ship this week.

name: Detroit Cobras at the Magic Stick in Detroit
description: Gig Poster for The Detroit Cobras Show in Detroit on June 1, 2013. Three colors hand screen printed on French Paper midnight Blue. Size is 12.5"x19". This edition was limited to 50 prints.

name: X with Reverend Horton Heat Gig Poster
description: This poster was created for the X show at Washington DC's 9:30 Club. It is a 3 color print on French Construction Nightshift Blue. Size is 12.5" x 19".

name: Detroit Cobras Winnipeg Poster July 2012 - Cancelled Show
description:
The ill-fated Detroit Cobras Canadian tour part deux. Commissioned for the summer 2012 date that was rescheduled from a previously cancelled date when the Cobras were turned away at the Canadian border. I guess it's just not meant to be but this 5-color screen printed 16"x20" poster exists to remind you of what could have been. 

Poster designed and printed by hand by Scott Walker (40oz Press).

name: X - The Los Angeles Tour
description:
Commissioned by the legendary band for their 2011 tour that featured a screening of the documentary "The Unheard Music" followed by a blistering set from the band in which they played the album Los Angeles in it's entirety. When Exene saw this poster, she said "that's the most important scene in the movie".

The art started as a charcoal drawing inspired of a scene from the documentary. The drawing was then combined with background colors, and type to create this 4-color 16"x20" screen printed poster.

Poster designed and printed by hand by Scott Walker (40oz Press).
